name.en: Chair of Public Economics and Policy

structural_unit_name.en: Chair of Public Economics and Policy

description.en: Objectives and instruments of economic policy are considered from different theory approaches. In the framework of normative theory there are based on the theory of market failures and searched answer for the question: how should be economic policy done in favor of society's interests. Positive approach is treated on the base of Public Choice Theory, which searches answer for the question: how is economic policy done in reality. Also there will be considered the theory of democratic economic policy, which tries to integrate normative and positive approach and open opportunities and problems of scientific policy advisory.
description.et: Käsitletakse majanduspoliitika eesmärke ja vahendeid teooria erinevate suundade seisukohalt. Normatiivse lähenemise raames tuginetakse turutõrgete teooriale ja otsitakse vastust küsimusele - kuidas peaks majanduspoliitikat ühiskonna huvides tegema. Positivistlikku suunda käsitletakse poliitika majandusliku teooria (Public Choice) alusel, mis otsib vastust küsimusele - kuidas majanduspoliitikat tegelikult tehakse. Käsitletakse ka nn demokraatliku majanduspoliitika teooriat, mis püüab integreerida positivistlikku ja normatiivset suunda ning avada teadusliku poliitikanõustamise probleeme ja võimalusi.

objectives.en: Explain the general reasons for state intervention in economy, its concrete objectives and instruments as from normative as well from positive economic theory approach.
objectives.et: Tutvustada üliõpilastele riigi majandusse sekkumise üldisi põhjuseid, selle konkreetseid eesmärke ja vahendeid nii normatiivse kui ka positivistliku teooria  seisukohalt.

learning_outcomes.en: Students manage to distinguish between practice and theory of economic policy and its main domains, including micro and macro level of economic policy, order, structural and process policy and normative and positive economic policy theory approach;  they know possible objectives of economic policy and problems of connection and choice between them; know main financial and legal instruments of economic policy, including role of public sector; can differentiate between market failures and possible welfare losses caused by them and know economic policy remedies against those welfare losses; understand reasons and consequences of state failures; can evaluate static and dynamic effectiveness of economic policy measures; can explain real economic policy as the result of cooperation action of policy subjects and connect problem of state failure with public and political institutions.
learning_outcomes.et:
Üliõpilased oskavad eristada majanduspoliitika praktikat ja teooriat ning nende põhisuundi, sh majanduspoliitika makro- ja mikrotasandit, korra-, struktuuri- ja protsessipoliitikat ning majanduspoliitika teooria normatiivset ja positivistlikku suunda;
tunnevad majanduspoliitika võimalikke eesmärke ning nende vahekorra ja valiku probleeme; tunnevad riigi majanduspoliitika põhilisi finants- ja õiguslikke instrumente, sh avaliku sektori rolli; eristavad turutõrkeid, nendega kaasnevaid võimalikke heaolukadusid ning majanduspoliitilisi vastumeetmeid; mõistavad riigitõrgete tekke põhjuseid ning nende tagajärgi; oskavad hinnata majanduspoliitiliste meetmete staatilist ja dünaamilist efektiivsust; oskavad seletada reaalset poliitikat kui erinevate poliitikasubjektide koostegevuse tulemust ning seostada riigitõrgete probleemi ühiskondlike ja poliitiliste institutsioonidega.

description.et:
There will be small tests, each worth max 5 points, in total 30 points,
case-study in groups - worth max 20 points
Mid-term test - max 30 points
Feedback about tests and mid-term test will be given at the beginning of following (next) class.

Seminar presentations on the positive theory of economic policy in teams of 3 students in each team - 20 points
Feedback by reply e-mail if the presentation has been sent to lecturer.

A - students have excellent knowledge (collected 100 - 91% from possible points in course) of theoretical concepts, goals, strategies and instruments of economic policy and in certain EU policies.
B - students have very good knowledge (collected 90 - 81% from possible points in course) of theoretical concepts, goals, strategies and instruments of economic policy and in certain EU policies.
C - students have good knowledge (collected 80 - 71% from possible points in course) of theoretical concepts, goals, strategies and instruments of economic policy and in certain EU policies.
D - students have satisfactory knowledge (collected 70 - 61% from possible points in course) of theoretical concepts, goals, strategies and instruments of economic policy and in certain EU policies.
E - students have poor knowlegde (collected 60 - 51% from possible points in course) of theoretical concepts, goals, strategies and instruments of economic policy and in certain EU policies

description.et: 24. week. 1. Lecture: Necessity  of economic policy (state intervention), practice and theory of economic policy (normative and positive approach).  Classification of economic policy (micro-, structural- and macro policies). Reading requirement: Acocella_Ch_2: Market failures: microeconomic aspects (normative approach) - for the lectures 1. - 4.

25. week: 2. Lecture: Regulative policy. Diversity of capitalism. Market failures (normative approach): microeconomic aspects. Reading requirement: Acocella_Ch_2.
B. Farkas "Models of Capitalism in the European Union"

26 .week: 3. Lecture: Externalities and their internalization. Public goods. Negotiations. Tradable permits. Bases of law and economics. Example of environmental policy. Economies of scale and sunk costs.  Information and adjustment failures (asymmetries). Risk, uncertainty and indeterminacy. Adverse selection and moral hazard. Signaling and screening. Consumer protection. Adjustment problems. Structural crisis.
Lecture is focused on Environmental Policy, lecturer Toghrul Pashabayli
27. week. 4. Lecture: Competition policy against intentional market failures. Structure-conduct-performance paradigm. Suggestions from Harvard and Chicago schools. Standard instruments. Acocella_Ch_7
28. week. 5. Students work individually as well in groups preparing case study report and presentation for the next 29th study-week.
29. week.  Colloquium: Case study presentations and discussions.

30. week. 6. Lecture: Structural policy: sectoral and regional. Structural changes of economy and their causes. Theory and practice of structural policy. Regional policy as a type of structural policy. Its objectives, strategies and instruments. Reading requirement: Acocella_Ch_8: Industrial and regional policies: redistributive polices

31. week. 7. Lecture: Macroeconomic policies: stabilization and monetary policy. Their objectives, strategies and instruments. Stabilization concepts. The optimum currency area criteria and application.
32. week. Mid-term test (closed books!): about the normative theory of economic policy. Lectures 1-7.

33. week. 9. Lecture: The positive theory of economic policy. Public choice theory. Politician as homo oeconomicus. Relations between politics and economy. State failures. Political business cycles. Lecturer Dr  Mariia Chebotareva
 
Reading requirement: Acocella_Ch_5: Government failures: elements of a positive theory of economic policy - for following lectures.

34. week. 10. Lecture:  Direct and representative democracy.  Agency relation and problems. Agency costs and factors influencing it. Role and possibilities of political competition. Downs' policy model. Examples and problems of orientation to median voter.  Browning' theorem. Real political-economical system. Role and problems of bureaucracy.  Niskanen model of bureaucracy. Interest groups and their influence potential. Lobbism. Rent-seeking. (Combat against state failures. Economics of constitution.  Rawlsian constitution theory. Decentralization of politics and system competition.  Levels and possibilities of scientific policy advisory.)
36. week. 1. Seminar (3h):  Seminar on the positive theory of economic policy. Seminar presentations.
37. week. 2. Seminar (3h):  Seminar on the positive theory of economic policy. Seminar presentations.
38. week. 3. Seminar (3h): Seminar on the positive theory of economic policy. Seminar presentations.
39. week. Final exam (closed books) on the whole course material.
